museum_name.value: Western Colorado Center for the Arts

raw_response.summary_short: Art center in Grand Junction offering exhibitions and community events, including major fundraisers and a concert series.
raw_response.summary_long: The Western Colorado Center for the Arts (The Art Center) in Grand Junction presents visual-arts programming alongside community events. Website listings highlight a flagship annual fundraiser (“Paint the Town 2026: The Golden Age of Hollywood”), a Center Stage concert series event, and a facilities-support mini-campaign, indicating an active, community-oriented institution.

collection_highlights.title: Community exhibitions and programs
collection_highlights.description: Programming emphasizes public-facing events and visits, suggesting rotating exhibitions and community engagement.

visitor_tips: Check the Events calendar before you go; major fundraisers and performances may affect gallery access.
Look for “Visit” information on the site to plan your arrival and on-site experience.
If you want a quieter gallery experience, avoid peak event nights like the Center Stage concert series.
raw_response.best_for: Travelers seeking a community-focused art venue with events and performances in Grand Junction.
